s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT CABLE FROM NEGATIVE BATTERY TERMINAL

atten2.ptxt: Wait at least 90 seconds after disconnecting the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal to prevent airbag activation.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR WIPER ARM AND BLADE ASSEMBLY (w/ Rear Wiper)

s2.ptxt: Open the wiper arm head cap.
Remove the nut and the arm and blade.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE CENTER STOP LIGHT COVER (w/ Center Stop Light)

s2.ptxt: Detach the 2 claws and 2 clips, and remove the cover.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE CENTER STOP LIGHT ASSEMBLY (w/ Center Stop Light)

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the connector and remove the stop light.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE BACK DOOR GLASS CHANNEL LH

s2.ptxt: Using a heat light, heat the channel.

atten3.ptxt: Do not heat the channel excessively.

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, detach the double-sided tape and back door glass channel LH.

atten4.ptxt: Tape the screwdriver tip before use.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE BACK DOOR GLASS CHANNEL RH

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedures described for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE BACK DOOR TRIM BOARD ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Detach the 16 clips and remove the back door trim board.
Disconnect the 2 rear window defogger connectors.
Apply protective tape to the outer surface of the vehicle body to prevent scratches.

atten3.ptxt: When separating the back door glass from the vehicle, be careful not to damage the vehicle's paint or interior/exterior ornaments.

s2.ptxt: From the interior, insert a piano wire between the vehicle body and back door glass as shown in the illustration.
Tie objects that can serve as handles (for example, wooden blocks) to both wire ends.
Cut through the adhesive by pulling the piano wire around the back door glass.

atten3.ptxt: Leave as much adhesive on the vehicle body as possible when removing the back door glass.

s2.ptxt: Using suction cups, remove the back door glass.
Clean the outer edge of the back door glass with white gasoline.

item.ptxt: Do not touch the back door glass surface after cleaning it.
Be careful not to damage the glass.
Even if using a new back door glass, clean the back door glass with white gasoline.

s2.ptxt: Using a scraper, remove the moulding and adhesive from the back door glass.
Clean and shape the contact surface of the vehicle body.

s3.ptxt: On the contact surface of the vehicle body, use a knife to cut away excess adhesive as shown in the illustration.

atten4.ptxt: Leave as much adhesive on the vehicle body as possible.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the vehicle body.

s3.ptxt: Clean the contact surface of the vehicle body with cleaner.

atten4.ptxt: Even if all the adhesive has been removed, clean the vehicle body.
